intro: Garuga madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar garuga, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, woody shrub form. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Garuga madagascariensis is adapted to the dry, arid conditions of its native habitat.
